basic_info.official_name: Government of Ireland International Education Scholarship (GOI-IES)
basic_info.provider: Government of Ireland, Higher Education Authority (HEA), Department of Further and Higher Education, Research, Innovation and Science

funding_info.funding_details: A €10,000 stipend for one year's study and a full fee waiver of all tuition and other registration costs at the higher education institution. 60 scholarships are awarded annually for one year of full-time study.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to outstanding non-EU/EEA students (citizens of countries other than the United Kingdom, Switzerland, the European Union, or the European Economic Area). Russian and Belarusian nationals are not eligible. Applicants must have a conditional or final offer of admission to an eligible Irish higher education institution at NFQ levels 9 or 10 (master’s, postgraduate diploma, or PhD) at the time of applying for the scholarship. Applicants must not have previously held a GOI-IES scholarship. Candidates should demonstrate academic excellence, leadership potential, a commitment to global engagement, and excellent communication abilities.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master’s, postgraduate diploma, or PhD programme (NFQ levels 9 or 10) in a wide range of disciplines at eligible Irish higher education institutions.

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Applicants must ensure they have sufficient additional funding or personal savings to cover other costs while studying in Ireland. Scholarship applications without an active offer to study at an Irish institution will not be considered. Applicants must be full-time, international, fee-paying students.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Personal statement, essay questions, academic transcripts, and other required documents.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Academic transcripts, recommendation letters, personal statements, GOI-IES Call Document, FAQs, Selection Process Infographic, Guidance for Referees, Application Help Document, indicative application form. Applicants register on the Government of Ireland scholarship portal to access the application form.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Primary assessment criteria include prior experience, personal statement, and references. Selection considers academic excellence, leadership potential, commitment to global engagement, communication abilities, and benefits to the applicant, HEI, Ireland, and their home country.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Government of Ireland International Education Scholarships (GOI-IES) is a prestigious, highly competitive, flagship funding offer for international students. It is funded by the Government of Ireland in partnership with Irish higher education institutions (HEIs) and managed by the Higher Education Authority (HEA). It aims to attract top-level international students to study in Ireland for one year of full-time study.

basic_info.provider: Italian Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation (MAECI)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded, including a monthly allowance of €900 to €1000. Some programs may have a total grant up to €9,000.
covered_expenses: Tuition fee waiver/exemption (except regional tax and tax stamp)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international applicants not residing in Italy and Italian nationals living abroad (IRE). Applicants must meet academic, age, and language criteria defined in the official call.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master's degrees, PhD programs, Bachelor's degrees, Higher Education in Arts, Music, and Dance (AFAM) programs, research under academic supervision, Italian language and culture courses. Programs include Humanities and Social Sciences, Political Science and International Relations, Health and Medical Sciences.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Incompatible with any other grant offered by the Italian Government or any other Italian public institution, including DSU grants.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Appropriate academic qualification required to enroll. For Master’s, a relevant bachelor’s degree is required. For Doctoral, a master’s degree is required. PhD applicants need to meet entry requirements and academic qualifications established by the University.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: For Italian-taught programs: Italian B2 (CEFR) required. For Italian language and culture courses: Italian A2 (CEFR) required. For English-taught programs: English B2 (CEFR) required, no Italian-language requirement. Applicants must attach a certificate proving proficiency in the required language.

additional_requirements.age_limits: For Master’s Degree, AFAM programs, and Italian Language and Culture advanced courses: applicants must be of age and shall not exceed 28 years by the application deadline (born after May 16th 1996), with exceptions for renewals. For PhD Programs: applicants must be under 30 years old by the deadline, with exceptions for renewals. Applicants must be between 18 and the specified upper age limit.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Scholarship can be renewed for the following academic year if students meet performance requirements.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must not be residing in Italy at the time of application (for international students).

background_and_logistics.official_website: https://www.esteri.it/en/opportunita/borse-di-studio/per-cittadini-stranieri/borsestudio_stranieri/ (official MAECI website) or Study in Italy portal (for application submission).
background_and_logistics.application_documents: Curriculum vitae (CV), personal statement (motivation letter, maximum 1000 words), transcripts, current passport, evidence of language competency, admission letter from the Italian university (required for PhD programs), score statement.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Selection is based on academic merit, motivation, and knowledge of the Italian or English language, depending on the program requirements.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The scholarship aims to strengthen international cultural and scientific cooperation, promote the Italian language and higher education system worldwide, and support Italy’s economic system.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarship covers a study period of 3 to 9 months. 9-month scholarships are available from November 1, 2025, to July 31, 2026, renewable. 3-month scholarships are available from January 1, 2026, to September 30, 2026, exclusively for advanced courses in Italian language and culture.

funding_info.funding_details: Provides financial assistance, including annual grants of RMB 20,000 for Bachelor's, RMB 30,000 for Master's, and RMB 40,000 for Doctoral degrees. Some sources mention up to CNY 2000/month.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Varies by university: Tianjin Normal University: June 30th, 2025; Tianjin University: May 31, 2025; Nankai University: May 20, 2025.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students from all countries, excluding citizens of the People’s Republic of China. Applicants must be in good health and meet the language requirements of the specific higher education institution. Some sources indicate a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 or equivalent and a degree in a relevant field. The scholarship is available for both prospective and current students and cannot be held concurrently with another Chinese government or TGU scholarship.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Wide range of programs offered by eligible universities.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Required to meet university-specific language requirements. For Chinese-instructed programs, HSK-5 (min 180) is typically required. For English-instructed programs, English Proficiency Certificates are needed. HSK exemption is possible for native Chinese speakers or those with Chinese as the instruction language at their highest educational level. Some mentions of 'No IELTS' for Tianjin University scholarships.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two Recommendation Letters (for Master/Doctoral/Senior Scholar programs)
additional_requirements.career_plan: Personal Statement (including study/research plan, personal background, financial situation, personal strengths) of no less than 800 words for Master/Doctoral and 300 words for Bachelor's.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Bachelor's: under 30 years. Master's: under 35 years. PhD: under 40 years.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: One-year duration, renewable annually. Open to both prospective and current students. Cannot hold another Chinese government or TGU scholarship simultaneously.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Original No Crime Certificate, Physical Examination Report and Test Report (Original Copy), Passport copy (including visa/residence permit page if applicable).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Tianjin Government Scholarship Application Form, Personal Statement, Two Recommendation Letters (for Master/Doctoral/Senior Scholar), English Proficiency Certificate or HSK-5 certificate (min 180), Passport copy.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applications are screened by the university (e.g., TGU School of International Education, which may include video/audio interviews). Assessment results are publicized for one week, then submitted to Tianjin Municipal Education Commission. Scholarship list is determined by experts organized by Tianjin Municipal Education Commission. Admission results announced and documents sent from July 1 to August 31.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Established by the Tianjin Municipal Government to attract international students to study at universities in Tianjin. Provides an opportunity for an internationally respected education in a vibrant Chinese city. It is a one-year duration scholarship, renewable annually, open to both prospective and current students.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Admission results announced and documents sent from July 1 to August 31.

basic_info.provider: Government of Flanders / Flemish Ministry of Education and Training

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded. Includes a grant of €10,020 per academic year and a tuition fee waiver. The duration is one academic year for a 60 ECTS master's programme or two academic years for a 120 ECTS master's programme.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Application deadlines vary by academic year and host institution. For the 2025-2026 academic year, the Master Mind application form deadline is March 15, 2025. For the 2026-2027 academic year, the Master Mind application form deadline is March 15, 2026. Host institution master's program application deadlines are typically earlier (e.g., January 15 for KU Leuven).

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to outstanding international students worldwide (except Russia). Applicants must apply to and be accepted by a Flemish higher education institution for a master's degree program in Flanders or Brussels. The previous degree (used for master's enrollment) cannot have been obtained at a Flemish higher education institution, but international students who have been on credit mobility (e.g., Erasmus+) in a Flemish institution are still eligible. Students already enrolled in a Flemish higher education institution cannot apply. The scholarship cannot be combined with another scholarship from the Flemish Government. Not eligible for preparatory or distance learning programs.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master’s Degree (60–120 ECTS) in any eligible program offered by participating Flemish host institutions.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Preparatory programs, bridging programs, and distance learning programs are not eligible. Specific programs at some universities may also be excluded.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Previous degree (e.g., Bachelor's) from a higher education institution outside Flanders, for which the student has been approved for the master's program.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Professional experience (not required but can be a competitive advantage)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Online language tests such as IELTS Indicator and TOEFL iBT Special Home Edition are accepted. Implies IELTS/TOEFL or equivalent language proficiency is required.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two signed letters of recommendation from professors are required, potentially specifically for the scholarship.
additional_requirements.age_limits: 30 years for Master's students by the time of application.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: International students who have completed a credit mobility program at a Flemish higher education institution are still eligible. Students already enrolled in a Flemish higher education institution are not eligible.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Excellent academic record with high GPA or academic distinction. Mandatory Master Mind Scholarship Application Form. Letter of motivation in English. Official letter of acceptance from the host university is needed before applying for the scholarship.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Master Mind Scholarship Application Form, KU Leuven Scholarships & Master Mind Candidacy Form (if applying to KU Leuven), Letter of exemption (from host university), Letter of motivation in English, Two signed letters of recommendation from professors, Official letter of acceptance from the host university.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Students cannot apply directly to the Flemish Government. Applicants must first apply for admission to an eligible master’s program at a participating Flemish host institution. Upon acceptance, the host institution preselects and nominates eligible students for the scholarship. The host institution then initiates the Master Mind scholarship application procedure by creating the candidate’s application file in the Mobility-Online tool. Shortlisted students are contacted by the university's International Office to complete their online Master Mind scholarship application. The International Relations Office screens files and submits a shortlist to the Flemish Government, which makes the final decision.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Master Mind Scholarship, funded by the Government of Flanders, provides an exceptional opportunity for outstanding international students to pursue a master’s degree (60 or 120 ECTS) in Flanders and Brussels. It aims to attract talented students globally.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Student applies to a master's program at a Flemish host institution (e.g., by Jan 15). Host institution accepts the student and nominates them for the scholarship. Host institution creates the scholarship application file in Mobility-Online. Shortlisted students complete the online Master Mind application (e.g., by March 15 or mid-April). The Flemish Government makes the final decision by the end of April.

basic_info.official_name: Beca Colombia Scholarship Program for Foreigners
basic_info.provider: Colombian Government (administered by ICETEX - Colombian Institute of Educational Credit and Technical Studies Abroad)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship program for international students.
covered_expenses: Monthly stipends (3x Colombian minimum wage, paid quarterly)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Foreign citizens from all nationalities; Not have Colombian nationality or dual nationality (Colombian); Not residing, nor having resided the last 6 months prior to applying for the scholarship in Colombian territory, or having started studies in Colombia at the time of application; Not having been a beneficiary of ICETEX through the Beca Colombia program in previous calls; Have a professional or bachelor’s degree; Be admitted to at least one (and up to three) eligible programs; Applicants from non-Spanish-speaking countries are also eligible.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master’s, Ph.D., and Specialization degree scholarships across various disciplines offered by accredited Colombian higher education institutions, specifically those listed in the 2025-2 ACADEMIC OFFER CATALOG.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Must study programs listed in the 2025-2 Academic Offer Catalogue.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 4.0 out of 5.0 on the Colombian scale (or equivalent)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Minimum Spanish language proficiency of B2. If Spanish is not the native language, a DELE or SIELE exam certificate with a B2 level is required.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Letter of Academic Recommendation (issued by an academic at the university where undergraduate studies were completed)
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Offered by reason of reciprocity for international cooperative received by Colombia under Educational Exchange Agreements. Country reciprocity (if your country gives scholarships to Colombians) may influence selection (10%).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Scholarship recipient agrees not to request a visa to remain in Colombia for two (2) years from the date the scholarship ends; must return to his/her country of origin or residence after the academic program ends.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Verified copies of Educational Transcripts; Experience report signed by the tutor or director of the academic program; Certificate from the University stating the current enrollment and the duration; Letter of Academic Recommendation; Spanish language proficiency test (DELE or SIELE) certificate.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Beca Colombia Scholarship Programme is coordinated by ICETEX, a Colombian government entity. It aims to foster academic, cultural, and technological exchange, while strengthening social ties between international students, Colombian citizens, institutions of higher learning, and strategic partners. Scholarships are offered for graduate studies (specialization, master’s, and doctorate) in Colombian higher education institutions.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Maximum duration of up to 12 months for specialization, 24 months (4 academic semesters) for Master's, and 36 months for Doctorate. Scholarships are awarded on an annual term; for programs longer than 12 months, scholars must request an extension for the subsequent year.
